Bauch: We need to work cooperatively to identify problems and come up with solutions that work. #sb285
Bauch:  we want to fill vacancies too. This bill doesn't do that.
Bauch:  Right now our corrections system is in a state of crisis all because of Act 10 and continued attacks on public service and workers
Troy Bauch testifies that Act 10 created an environment of intimidation and fear in civil service.
RT @AndrewBahl: .@wisaflcio rep says civil service bill will "open the floodgates for political favoritism"
Stephanie Bloomingdale, Secretary-Treasurer of the Wisconsin AFL-CIO, testifying against SB285 (Civil Service... http://t.co/wbcqXoXEtR
Bloomingdale: Asks if there will there be hearings around the state for citizens to better understand bill.  Sen. Nass answers no.
Bloomingdale: To address recruitment & retention I urge you to restore collective bargaining rights so workers have meaningful voice @ work
Bloomingdale: Transferring hiring authority to DOA, direct extension of Walker's office, ensures resumes of political favs get priority
Bloomingdale: without blind examination hiring can be made based on political connections.
Bloomingdale: Current system has safeguards to ensure integrity & public trust. People should be hired on what they know, not who they know
Bloomingdale: On behalf of Wisconsin's working people I have to ask what's the hurry? Any changes should be made in open and inclusive way
Stephanie Bloomingdale kicks off afternoon testimony to speak out against changes to our civil service law
Badger: we should be working together to improve civil service. we could have a better bill if we took the time to talk together
Spink: 10-year veterans earning the same as entrance level workers. can't attract the best if jobs don't pay family-supporting wages
Spink: we're lowering the bar because of the way public workers are being treated and compensated under Gov. Walker -- can't fill openings
Spink: exam, timeline not stopping qualified candidates. way public employees are being treated is stopping best & brightest from applying
Paul Spink, 12-yr state employee working with children in Milwaukee, now testifying against SB285.
Badger: public employees already lost right to speak out freely at bargaining table of problems without retribution
Badger:  no one goes into civil service to get rich, people do so to help state
Badger: public employees have been scapegoated, pay/benefits have been slashed under Walker...makes civil service job less attractive
Rick Badger, AFSCME Council 32, testifying against SB285 designed to gut WI civil service law. #1u #WIunion
Correction:  Jim Thiel, Association of Career Employees, testified against SB285. (previous tweets listed last name as Theo).
Walker's DOA reps. testify in support of legislation. Surprise, surprise.

Theo notes current hold ups in hiring usually lie with DOA #sb285
Theo states current civil service law protects taxpayers. Changes not needed and not designed to adequately address any current problems
Theo also testifies he has witnessed discrimination against citizens who signed recall petition and were most qualified candidates
Jim Theo testifying at SB285 hearing that in 40 years of management in Civil Service he never had trouble firing a worker
